member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceDescriptor.LazyInitialization
member.summary: Gets a flag describing whether the chunk source initializes lazily. File-based chunk sources will not be activated until a file that it targets is requested for indexing.

list.item: File-based chunk sources must be lazily initialized, and will only be activated if there's a request matching .
Non-file based chunk sources that lazily initialize will be initialized when any non-file request is seen. This behavior may be subject to change.

member.summary: Gets information on the files that are targeted by the chunk source, if it does so. This property is optional.
member.remarks: This property should be left null if the chunk source does not target files. Chunk sources that target files will activate lazily in response to matching files being requested for indexing.

member.summary: Gets of the file chunk source used during the file matching process.

member.summary: Holds information on a pattern used to specify what potential target files the file chunk source should process.

member.summary: Gets the pattern used for matching a file to a file chunk source.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceTargetFilesPattern.PatternType
member.summary: Gets the used for matching a file to a file chunk source.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceTargetFilesPatternType
member.summary: Specifies the type of pattern used for matching a file to a file chunk source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceTargetFilesPatternType.Extension
member.summary:
Represents that the pattern of the file chunk source is an extension and should be compared to the extension of a file (including the leading period) to determine a match, e.g., ".cs", ".cpp", etc.
An empty pattern associated with this type will match files without an extension, e.g., README, LICENSE, etc. Specifying a multipart extension, e.g., ".tar.gz", will not match any files. Matching for this pattern type is done from the last period to the end of the file name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceFileMatchingPriority
member.summary: Specifies the priority of the pattern used for resolving the file chunk source when a file matches multiple patterns.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceFileMatchingPriority.None
member.summary: Represents that the pattern does not have any priority.
member.remarks: When a file matches multiple patterns, the chunk source could only be chosen if the other file sources have the same priority, but without any guarantee.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceFileMatchingPriority.Low
member.summary: Represents that the pattern has low priority.
member.remarks: When a file matches multiple patterns, the chunk source will be chosen if the other file sources have lower priority. If other file sources have the same priority, the chunk source could be chosen, but without any guarantee.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Copilot.UnstableInternalApi.Indexing.ChunkSourceFileMatchingPriority.High
member.summary: Represents that the pattern has high priority.
member.remarks: When a file matches multiple patterns, the chunk source will be chosen if the other file sources have lower priority. If another file source has the same priority, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Messages
member.summary: Gets or sets the messages to generate chat completions for, in the chat format.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Model
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the model to use.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.CopilotModel
member.summary: Gets the to use for the request.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Temperature
member.summary: Gets or sets the sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.TopP
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of p to use for nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.N
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Stream
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether to stream the response. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Stop
member.summary: Gets or sets up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.MaxTokens
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. If unspecified, the response can be up to the model's maximum output size.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.PresencePenalty
member.summary: Gets or sets a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.FrequencyPenalty
member.summary: Gets or sets a number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.LogitBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the modification of the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Tools
member.summary:
Gets or sets the functions to be considered.
When providing one or more functions the model may choose to call one of them in the response. See .
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-tools

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.ToolChoice
member.summary:
Gets the value indicating whether to consider calling in responses. Can be set to required to enforce the use of a tool in the response. If null, the implied value is "none" if no tools are provided, and "auto" if tools are provided.
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-tool_choice

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.ParallelToolCalls
member.summary:
Gets the value indicating whether to enable parallel tool calling.
Defaults to true
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-parallel_tool_calls

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.OffTopicFilterText
member.summary: Gets the text to be used for off topic filtering (or not) the request.

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Prediction
member.summary:
Gets the predicted output.
Full documentation: https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create#chat-create-prediction

member.name: P:CopilotClient.CopilotAPIRequest.Snippy
member.summary: Gets or sets the configuration for Snippy the GitHub Copilot filter that detects code suggestions matching public code on GitHub. Snippy can be explicitly enabled or disabled by setting an 'enabled' key in the dictionary with a value of true or false. If the Snippy property is null then Snippy will be enabled/disabled depending on the configuration for the current user. For Microsoft accounts Snippy is enabled by default and cannot be disabled via GitHub https://aka.ms/copilot-chat-filtered-docs.
